verses.text_plain: And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.
verses.verse_html: 1And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:
verses.verse_html: 2And the Lord appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:

verses.text_plain: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;
verses.verse_html: 3Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;

tokens.text: and I will be with thee, and will bless
thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed

verses.text_plain: And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
verses.verse_html: 4And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;

verses.text_plain: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
verses.verse_html: 5Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
verses.verse_html: 6And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:

verses.text_plain: And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
verses.verse_html: 7And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
verses.verse_html: 8And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die for her.
verses.verse_html: 9And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die for her.

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.
verses.verse_html: 10And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
verses.verse_html: 11And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.

verses.text_plain: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
verses.verse_html:
12Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
 received: Heb. found

verses.text_plain: And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
verses.verse_html:
13And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
 went: Heb. went going

footnotes.body_html: went: Heb. went going

verses.text_plain: For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the Philistines envied him.
verses.verse_html:
14For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the Philistines envied him.
 servants: or, husbandry

verses.text_plain: For all the wells which his fathers servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
verses.verse_html: 15For all the wells which his fathers servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
verses.verse_html: 16And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.

tokens.text: from us; for thou art much

verses.text_plain: And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
verses.verse_html: 17And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
verses.verse_html: 18And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.

verses.text_plain: And Isaacs servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
verses.verse_html:
19And Isaacs servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
 springing: Heb. living

verses.text_plain: And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaacs herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.
verses.verse_html:
20And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaacs herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.
 Esek: that is, Contention

footnotes.body_html: Esek: that is, Contention

verses.text_plain: And they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
verses.verse_html:
21And they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
 Sitnah: that is, Hatred

tokens.text: for that also: and he called

footnotes.body_html: Sitnah: that is, Hatred

verses.text_plain: And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the Lord hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
verses.verse_html:
22And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the Lord hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
 Rehoboth: that is Room

tokens.text: for us, and we shall be fruitful

footnotes.body_html: Rehoboth: that is Room

verses.text_plain: And he went up from thence to Beersheba.
verses.verse_html: 23And he went up from thence to Beersheba.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abrahams sake.
verses.verse_html: 24And the Lord appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abrahams sake.

verses.text_plain: And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the Lord, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaacs servants digged a well.
verses.verse_html: 25And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the Lord, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaacs servants digged a well.

verses.text_plain: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.
verses.verse_html: 26Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
verses.verse_html: 27And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?

tokens.text: ye to me, seeing ye hate
me, and have sent me away

verses.text_plain: And they said, We saw certainly that the Lord was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
verses.verse_html:
28And they said, We saw certainly that the Lord was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
 We saw: Heb. Seeing we saw

tokens.text: was with thee: and we said
Let there be now an oath
us and thee, and let us make

footnotes.body_text: We saw: Heb. Seeing we saw
footnotes.body_html: We saw: Heb. Seeing we saw

verses.text_plain: That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
29That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the Lord.
 That: Heb. If thou shalt

tokens.text: thee, and as we have done

footnotes.body_html: That: Heb. If thou shalt

verses.text_plain: And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
verses.verse_html: 30And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.

verses.text_plain: And they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
verses.verse_html: 31And they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass the same day, that Isaacs servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, We have found water.
verses.verse_html: 32And it came to pass the same day, that Isaacs servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, We have found water.

tokens.text: And it came to pass the same day

verses.text_plain: And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.
verses.verse_html:
33And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.
 Shebah: That is, an oath
 ,
 Beersheba: that is, the well of the oath

footnotes.body_html: Shebah: That is, an oath

footnotes.body_text: Beersheba: that is, the well of the oath
footnotes.body_html: Beersheba: that is, the well of the oath

verses.text_plain: And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:
verses.verse_html: 34And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:

verses.text_plain: Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
verses.verse_html:
35Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
 a grief: Heb. bitterness of spirit

footnotes.body_text: a grief: Heb. bitterness of spirit
footnotes.body_html: a grief: Heb. bitterness of spirit
